hc.server.util.scheduler

Class WeeklyJobCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseJobCalendar
      • hc.server.util.scheduler.WeeklyJobCalendar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JobCalendar, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class WeeklyJobCalendar
extends BaseJobCalendar
implements JobCalendar, Serializable

    This implementation of the JobCalendar excludes a set of days of the week. You may use it to exclude weekends for example. But you may define any day of the week. By default it excludes SATURDAY and SUNDAY.

    Author:
    Juergen Donnerstag
    See Also:
    JobCalendar

    • Method Detail

      • areAllDaysExcluded

        public boolean areAllDaysExcluded()

        Check if all week days are excluded. That is no day is included.

        Returns:
        boolean

      • clone

        public Object clone()
        Specified by:
        clone in interface JobCalendar

      • getDaysExcluded

        public boolean[] getDaysExcluded()

        Get the array with the week days

      • getNextIncludedTime

        public long getNextIncludedTime(long timeStamp)

        Determine the next time (in milliseconds) that is 'included' by the JobCalendar after the given time. Return the original value if timeStamp is included. Return 0 if all days are excluded.

        Note that this JobCalendar is only has full-day precision.

        Specified by:
        getNextIncludedTime in interface JobCalendar

      • isDayExcluded

        public boolean isDayExcluded(int wday)

        Return true, if wday (see JobCalendar.get()) is defined to be exluded. E. g. saturday and sunday.

      • isTimeIncluded

        public boolean isTimeIncluded(long timeStamp)

        Determine whether the given time (in milliseconds) is 'included' by the JobCalendar.

        Note that this JobCalendar is only has full-day precision.

        Specified by:
        isTimeIncluded in interface JobCalendar

      • setDayExcluded

        public void setDayExcluded(int wday,
                  boolean exclude)

        Redefine a certain day of the week to be excluded (true) or included (false). Use Calendar.SUNDAY - Calendar.SATURDAY to determine the wday.

      • setDaysExcluded

        public void setDaysExcluded(boolean[] weekDays)

        Redefine the array of days excluded. The array must of size greater or equal 8. java.util.Calendar's constants like MONDAY should be used as index. A value of true is regarded as: exclude it.
